pull.title: wallet: Avoid calling uiInterface.LoadWallet(...) with cs_wallet held

events.message: wallet: Avoid calling uiInterface.LoadWallet(...) with cs_wallet held

events.body: Can you explain why this is needed?
@MarcoFalke before #11634 the lock wasn't held when calling `uiInterface.LoadWallet(walletInstance)`. My suggestion was to revert that ~~behaviour~~ change.
Yeah, I don't see the change in behaviour. Is there any?
Ah ok. Slightly tend to NACK due to our refactoring guidelines.
I don't get it why this is refactoring, this should just revert something that was changed for no good reason. Anyway it was just a comment.

issue.title: wallet: Call load handlers without cs_wallet locked
issue.body:
Don't have `cs_wallet` locked while calling each `context.wallet_load_fns`. A load handler can always lock `cs_wallet` if needed.

The lock was added in 1c7e25db0c to satisfy TSAN. With 44c430ffac most of the code requiring the lock is in `CWallet::AttachChain`. A comment is added to warn about wallets_mutex and cs_wallet lock ordering.
